thread.title: Rajon Rondo, George Karl off to a predictably bitter start
thread.title_full: Rajon Rondo, George Karl off to a predictably bitter start | New York Post

author: Brian Lewis
title: Rajon Rondo, George Karl off to a predictably bitter start
text:
As soon as Rajon Rondo signed with Sacramento, many wondered how deep into the season the high-drama guard would get before clashing with prickly coach George Karl. Turns out he didn’t even make it to the season.
With the Kings still in the preseason, Rondo acknowledged he and Karl have already been at odds.
“It’s not been going too well. We’ve gotten into a couple of arguments the past couple of days,’’ Rondo said in an interview with Cowbell Kingdom. “But hopefully we’ll continue to talk and get better.”
The volatile point guard arguing with a coach isn’t shocking. But considering Karl had a very high-profile beef with DeMarcus Cousins this summer , issues with Rondo felt like forgone conclusion.
The point guard is still just 29 years old, a former NBA champion and a four-time All-Star, but it says something about his act that Boston was willing to trade him to Dallas last season. Rondo being Rondo, he clashed with Rick Carlisle and got buried in the Mavericks coach’s doghouse, reportedly unwilling to adapt his game to Carlisle’s system.
The problems was so bad in Dallas, Rondo was de-activated during the postseason. In the offseason, Kings general manager Vlade Divac took a shot on Rondo’s talent, hoping for the best regarding his temperament.
Sacramento is 4-1 in the preseason – the most wins in the NBA – and has assembled a talented roster . Asked if he was excited for the regular season, Rondo replied with a one-word answer, “Yeah.”
Rondo was also asked if this Kings team had the same feel as his early Celtics squads.
“It’s a completely different team, different makeup, different personality,’’ Rondo said. “Everything is different.’’
Not everything.
  Filed under george karl ,  nba ,  rajon rondo ,  sacramento kings
